concept.deftn: The numbered/lettered page range that comprises an individual resource.

bestPractices.practice: Use for articles (journal, magazine, newsletter, proceedings or encyclopedia entries), book chapters, book forewords, book reviews, bibliographies/indexes or portions of technical notes and reports.
Enter either the page start or page end depending on which field you are completing.
Complete using Arabic numerals and/or letters, as appropriate.
Use a hyphen between the start and end pages (e.g. 53-67).
When page numbers already use hyphens, use a slash between the start and end pages (e.g. 1-2/1-17).

Some publishers, such as AGU, utilize article and/or citation numbers (e.g. EG4066032) rather than traditional page numbers. Thus, enter the article/citation number in the Identifier field, and leave this field blank.
Do not enter the total number of pages (e.g. 53 pp).
Do not use this field when you would express the entire page span for an item (e.g. entire journals, magazines, newsletters, proceedings, books, or encyclopedias). Use the Total Pages field instead.
Do not preface or follow the pages with a number sign or any abbreviations.
